subject: Learning
title: What Is Metacognition?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Is Metacognition?.

hook.text: You know you're bad at remembering names. That awareness itself is a powerful cognitive skill.

buildup.text: Metacognition means thinking about your own thinkingâ€”knowing what you know and what you don't.

discovery.text: It has two parts: metacognitive knowledge (what you know about your learning) and regulation (what you do about it).

twist.text: Students with strong metacognition outperform higher-IQ students who lack it. Self-awareness beats raw ability.

climax.text: It's the skill behind all skillsâ€”without it, you can't identify what to improve.

punchline.text: The smartest learners aren't the fastest. They know themselves best.

quiz.question: What are the two components of metacognition?
